title: Why Duskblade Is The Most Broken Item In The Game
body:
No, this is not another assassin nerf post. It's not about the damage duskblade provides.


What makes duskblade **INCREDIBLY** broken is the "Nightstalker" passive. No, it's not the damage portion.

The thing is, at the bottom of your screen (above your abilities) when you have duskblade you can see if Nightstalker is up. Let me quote the passive:
"After being unseen for at least 1 second, your next basic attack against an enemy champion deals x"

I know alot of people don't know about this, but I've abused it for a while. If you haven't figured it out yet, I'll tell you exactly what's wrong.
This passive allows you to go in a bush and you will ALWAYS be able to tell if its warded or not.

If the bush isn't warded, the Nightstalker passive duskblade provides will be at the bottom as per usual.

if it IS warded however, your passive will start fading away. You may not be able to break the ward like you can with the "Blackout" passive, but this means it becomes WAY easier setting up ambushes. You will know where the enemy team has warded the entire game after buying this item. 

And yes, this passive is broken. Vision is incredibly powerful but duskblade negates that. Assassins that knows about this interaction are always safe standing in any bush as they can see their Nightstalker passive being up.

Seriously? You are trying to say that Gunblade is in the same spot as Duskblade? If Gunblade needs to be nerfed/removed then most of the items (for other classes) also need to go away.

Duskblade deals 65 -320 and 45 - 300 in 1 second intervals (considering you are hidden and it is easily abused by adcs, MF is an exame) while Hextech Gunblade deals 175 - 253 (+30% AP) in 40 seconds intervals (with Luden's it gets increased a bit more; although, luden's get procced by almost anything).

Truth is, the problem is not Duskblade alone (although early game it does its job pretty freaking well), it is its junction with other lethality items that makes it broken because they all bring your armor down to 0 in the blink of an eye and after that you will surely "consume" the full damage of its passive. Not to mention that Gunblade is equally broken to Duskblade ONLY when you are ahead, and Duskblade is broken even if you are behind (not tooooo behind of course, and even then ...).

While with Gunblade, you not only have to wait (although I agree its cooldown should be a bit bigger ... 60-40 seconds (per level) seems fine) to deal damage as it does not provide you any magic penetration whatsoever (to allow its passive to reach its full potential). Its healing, however, is ... meh, Akali is currently the only champ you can actually abuse this massively (although her passive is the thing that helps with this) - Death's Dance healing is way worse (because of the lethality + crit).

 All in all I think Hextech is pretty good, and duskblade is genuinely 10 times worse, although Gunblade deals more damage than Duskblade around 156 AP, it still is not constantly getting activated (then we have the vision part). For instance, I managed to proc Duskblade 4 times in a row ... please ...

> Seriously? You are trying to say that Gunblade is in the same spot as Duskblade? If Gunblade needs to be nerfed/removed then most of the items (for other classes) also need to go away.

Both of them are cancerous items with horrendous designs that for some reason have a chunk of burst damage attached to them. The first step in properly balancing assassins would be to remove items like that for some that actually offer a niche like movement speed from Yomuu's for example. Other items don't have to go away nor be nerfed, some assassins would simply get tweaked. Also, they are generally too good when compared to other items so they simply MUST be built every game. Woo, so many itemization choices.

Duskablade gives all the stats that an assassin could wish for alongside having overloaded passives tied to it. First thing that needs to happen is the removal of CDR on it and the removal of the stupid slow that melees still have for some reason.

Gunblade is the same thing as Duskblade. Really good stats alongside overloaded passives. It has an incredibly stupid chunk of burst damage that also applies a slow and it becomes impossible for someone to escape the assassin that's approaching them (which is sorta like the slow on the duskblade as well). The sustain only makes it even less interactive since you have unnecessary healing on champions that shouldn't get so much sustain. Try pairing Gunblade with the new rune, Ravenous Hunter, as see how "meh" the sustain from it is. Also, any champion that takes Gunblade benefits a lot from the sustain, not just Akali.
